Range

Use the range component to define minimum and maximum values for an input field. You can also use the range component as a filter.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-range

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-range

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-range/src/scss/range";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Import JS

                  
                  import { Range } from '@govflanders/vl-ui-range';

Info and options

Add the range handles and the 'From' and 'To' input fields inside the range component. Update the values depending on the range you want to offer. [data-vl-range] or .js-vl-range (deprecated) Add this attribute to the wrapping container of the range component. .js-vl-range__from-input and .js-vl-range__to-input Add both classes to the 'From' and 'To' input fields. .js-vl-range__from-handle and .js-vl-range__to-handle Add both classes to the 'From' and 'To' handles. Add the following aria tags to the HTML handles: aria-valuemin, aria-valuemax, aria-valuenow, aria-valuetext & aria-label. Fill in the default values. JS will update the values on user interaction. For accessibility, add role="slider" to make sure that screenreaders can interpret the aria tags correctly.

Range

Basic appearance of the range component with live updates of the input fields according to the slider position

      <div class="vl-range" data-vl-range>
    <div class="vl-range__from-label">
      <label for="from" class="vl-range__input-label">Van</label>
      <input class="vl-input-field vl-input-field--small js-vl-range__from-input"
        type="number"
        id="from"
        name="from"
        value="0"
        pattern="[0-9]*">
    </div>
    <div class="vl-range__to-label">
      <label for="to" class="vl-range__input-label">Tot</label>
      <input class="vl-input-field vl-input-field--small js-vl-range__to-input"
        type="number"
        id="to"
        name="to"
        value="999"
        pattern="[0-9]*">
    </div>
    <div class="vl-range__slider js-vl-range__slider">
      <div class="vl-range__slider-range js-vl-range__slider-range"></div>
        <i class="vl-vi vl-vi-arrow-right-fat js-vl-range__from-handle vl-range__handle vl-range__handle-from"
          role="slider"
          tabindex="0"
          aria-valuemin="0"
          aria-valuenow="0"
          aria-valuetext="0"
          aria-valuemax="999"
          aria-label="Minimumwaarde"></i>
        <i class="vl-vi vl-vi-arrow-left-fat js-vl-range__to-handle vl-range__handle vl-range__handle-to"
          role="slider"
          tabindex="0"
          aria-valuemin="0"
          aria-valuenow="999"
          aria-valuetext="999"
          aria-valuemax="999"
          aria-label="Maximumwaarde"></i>
    </div>
  </div>

Accessibility

The following functionalities are built in to ensure an accessible and user-friendly component:

  • Tabbing navigation to allow focus on the input fields and to increase or decrease the value of each handle using the arrow keys.
  • Tabbing navigation to allow focus on a handle and move it using the arrow keys.
  • HTML5 input (type='number') to increase or decrease the value by using the up & down arrows of the browser's input field. Updating the values using the keyboard will update the range accordingly.
  • Aria tags to make sure that screenreaders interpret every user interaction correctly.
